item.description: Global Day of Coderetreat by swkWien at Nagarro A day of deliberate practice and learning. TODO: Code of Conduct Mindset Thx nagarro Feedback form Join SWK … 💗 Big Thank you to Nagarro! Thank you very much for hosting us! 🍽️ Dinner Who wants to join the dinner? Is this your first Coderetreat? Please raise your hand. What is a Coderetreat? A day of deliberate practice and learning.

Coderetreat A day of deliberate practice and learning. 🍎 + 🐍 + 🕹️ → 💯 Our Kata 🍎 + 🐍 + 🕹️ → 💯 = Snake! https://g.co/kgs/5Sxo4e A snake moves. The player makes it turn. Collect points by eating apples. If the snake runs into a wall or itself, the game is over. Implement a console game. Our focus ⚙️ Incremental Development Questions? Before we start… What do you want from today?

Session 1 Pen and Paper Facilitator: Claus Aichinger Pen & Paper Before we start coding, let’s think. Familiarize yourself with the problem: Find a common language. Identify concepts. Make a sketch. Be explicit. Tips Introduce terminology. “A picture is worth a thousand words”. If you prefer a digital sketching solution: https://cocreate.csail.mit.edu/. 🤝 Find a Pair 📝 Pen & Paper 🤔 Retrospective What have you learned about the game?

Session 2 First attempt to make small steps Facilitator: Peter Kofler, @codecopkofler 🏓 TDD with Ping Pong Let’s do TDD and Pair Programming in a strict way, switching after each increment: A writes a test and sees that it fails. B writes the code needed to pass the test. A (or B) refactors the code as needed. B writes the next test and sees that it fails. A writes the code needed to pass the test.

Session 3 Make Even Smaller Steps! Facilitator: Paul Rohorzka, @paulroho Take Baby Steps! Why Baby Steps? Your 🧠 is limited. A clear head works better. Ingenuity seldom works. Steady progress feels great. TDD Baby Steps Flow Decide on a step. Set a 3 minute timer. Code! 🤓 Works? → Repeat ⏲ Time out? reset --hard Make the step smaller!

Session 4 Write smaller units! Facilitator: Rea Sutter 🤏 Minimalist Code Max. 3 fields per class Max. 3 methods per class Max. 3 statements per method Tips Refactor to keep units small Extract variable Extract method Extract class 🤝 Find a Pair 💻 Coding Pair Programming TDD Focus on Constraints 🤔 Retrospective How did this approach affect the readability of your code?

Session 5 TCR Test Commit Revert Facilitator: Adam Zielinski, @adam0x5A test && commit || revert The new style versus test-driven development TCR - why? Limbo lower now - Limbo lower now - How low can you go? If you don’t want a bunch of code wiped out then don’t write a bunch of code between greens. TCR - how? Add test and pass. The goal here is to shorten the time between idea and some kind of test passing in some kind of way.

🤔 Final Retrospective What did you learn? What did you enjoy? What did surprise you? What do you take away? Feedback Please take a few minutes, we appreciate your input. You liked it? 🤝 Join us on Softwerkskammer.org (The Vienna chapter.) Global Day of Coderetreat by swkWien at Nagarro A day of deliberate practice and learning. Thank you for joining us today! 🥳
